sen.j: 渡辺 綱（わたなべ・の・つな、天暦7年（953年） - 万寿2年2月15日（1025年3月17日））は平安時代中期の武将。
sen.e: WATANABE no Tsuna (953 - March 17, 1025) was a military commander during mid-Heian Period.

sen.j: 嵯峨源氏の源融の子孫で、通称は渡辺源次、正式な名のりは源綱（みなもと の つな）。
sen.e: He was a descendant of MINAMOTO no Toru of Saga Genji, and his common name was Genji WATANABE and his official name was MINAMOTO no Tsuna.

sen.j: 摂津源氏の源満仲の娘婿である源氏の源敦の養子となり、母方の里である摂津国西成郡渡辺（現大阪府大阪市中央区 (大阪市)）に居住し、渡辺綱（わたなべ の つな）、あるいは渡辺源次綱（わたなべ の げんじ つな）、源次綱（げんじ つな）と称し、渡辺氏の祖となる。
sen.e: He became an adopted son of MINAMOTO no Atsushi of Genji, who was the husband of a daughter of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka of Settsu Genji; he lived in his mother's hometown of Watanabe, Nishinari County, Settsu Province (present-day Chuo Ward, Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture (Osaka City)) and he was named WATANABE no Tsuna, WATANABE no Genjitsuna or Tsuna GENJI, and he became the patriarch of Watanabe clan.

sen.j: 摂津源氏の源頼光に仕え、頼光四天王の筆頭として剛勇で知られた。
sen.e: He served MINAMOTO no Yorimitsu, and he was known for his valiance as the head of Yorimitsu's four loyal retainers.

sen.j: 大江山の酒呑童子退治や、京都の一条戻り橋の上で羅城門の鬼の腕を源氏の名刀「髭切」で切り落とした逸話で有名。
sen.e: He is famous for anecdotes of his subjugation of Shuten Doji at Mount Oe-yama and for slicing off the arm of Rajo-mon Gate ogre on Ichijo-modori-bashi Bridge in Kyoto with the celebrated sword of Genji known as "Higekiri."

sen.j: その子孫は渡辺氏と呼ばれ、内裏警護に従事する滝口武者として、また摂津国の武士団として住吉区（住之江）の海（大阪湾）を本拠地として瀬戸内海の水軍を統轄し、源平の争乱から南北朝にかけて活躍した。
sen.e: His descendants were called the Watanabe clan, and as Takiguchi-no-Musha serving as guards of the Imperial Palace precincts, and as a group of warriors of Settsu Province based at the sea of Sumiyoshi Ward (Suminoe) (Osaka Bay), they were in charge of the navy in the Seto Inland Sea and they flourished from Taira-Minamoto War to Northern and Southern Dynasties.
